description.en: The course will have three parts: an introduction to core components of social science methodology, an examination of approaches to research design and case selection, and the application of methodological analysis to specific research works. It will also feature the pedagogical approach of a flipped classroom, in which in-class assignments and group work will figure prominently.
description.et: Kursusel on kolm osa: sotsiaalteaduste metodoloogia põhikomponendid, uurimisstrateegiad ja juhtumite valimine (research design), ning metodoloogiliste analüüside läbiviimine konkreetsete teadustööde näitel. Aine kasutab aktiivselt ka nn pööratud klassiruumi lähenemist, mis sisaldab iseseisvat eeltööd videote ja muude materjalide läbitöötamisel, mille tulemusel keskendutakse auditoorsetel kohtumistel praktilistele rühmategevustele.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to provide students a foundation in social science methodology that will serve as a basis for their studies in the rest of the program and for completing the MA thesis.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda üliõpilastele sotsiaalteaduste metodoloogia baasteadmised, mis toetavad nii magistriõppekava ülejäänud ainekursuste läbimist kui magistritöö kirjutamist.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, students will:
1) understand the main tenets of social science methodology as well as the sequence structure of methodological research;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) mõistab sotsiaalteaduste metodoloogia põhialuseid ja metodoloogilise uurimuse etappe ning ülesehitust;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) understand essential epistemological perspectives on social science as well as formulate their own opinion concerning these issues;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) teab sotsiaalteaduste põhilisi epistemoloogilisi vaatenurki ja oskab formuleerida oma seisukohti nendes küsimustes;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) understand and apply the fundamentals of social science research design (large-N, comparative method, single case study);
learning_outcomes.et: 3) teab ja oskab kasutada sotsiaalteaduste uurimisstrateegiate aluspõhimõtteid (suur N, võrdlev meetod, juhtumiuuring);

learning_outcomes.en: 4) be capable of identifying and maturely evaluating the methodological approaches of other scholarly works;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) on suuteline ära tundma ja kriitiliselt hindama teiste teadustööde metodoloogiat;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) begin the process of applying the same methodological rigor to one's own work, particularly with a view to the final MA thesis.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) on valmis kasutama õpitud metodoloogilisi põhimõtteid ka oma teadustöös, eriti magistritöös.

description.et: First article analysis: correct completion of the Article Analysis template for the given scholar article.
Second article analysis: correct completion of the Article Analysis template for the given scholar article.
MA thesis prospectus: logical and thought-through outline of the MA thesis project, including main conceptual framework, research design and overview of empirical research tasks.
Participation in group assignments and tasks: attendance and evaluation of group tasks.

grade_preconditions.et:
1) Submission of a minimally passing (16/30 points) MA thesis prospectus.
2) Completion of the on-line academic ethics test with at least a score of 90%.

grade_evaluation.et:
In addition to the two prerequisite conditions noted above, final grades will be based on four components: (1) regular attendance in class, (2) the results of two in-class group assignments, where groups must evaluate a scientific article collectively, (3) two individually completed written methodological analyses of example social science journal articles, (4) a final written assignment in which the student must work out an advanced MA thesis prospectus based on the methodological precepts learned during the course.

Attendance: 10 points (in-class)
Task sheets: 2 x 5 points (in-class)
Article analyses: 2 x 25 points
MA thesis application: 30 points

debt_elimination.et: All written assignments must be submitted via Moodle, where a computer-enforced deadline will be enforced. Therefore, late papers may only be submitted directly to the instructor (stefano.braghiroli@ut.ee) and will be penalized 2 points for the first 24-hour period of delay. Thereafter, submissions will not be accepted since the answers to the assignment will be discussed in the next class period. Extensions in relation to deadlines will be granted only in exceptional and well-justified cases (academic related travel, serious illness, etc). Excuses related to outside work responsibilities or personal activities will not be accepted.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
